75.6: ... Since he was spoiled [by sinning] the Holy One set His hand upon him and diminished him, for it is said, ‘and You laid Your palm upon me’.

215.16: Said the dove before the Holy One: Master of the world,  may my food be bitter like olive and given over in (by) Your hand, and may it not be sweet like honey and given over by a hand of flesh and blood.

214.19: [A teaching of R’ Yehoshua ben Qorchah] [answers this question with a parable:] A man made a wedding for his son, preparing a feast.  When his son died, “he stood and destroyed his [son’s] wedding canopy.  He said: For nothing else did I make the canopy except for my son. Now that he has died, what [use is it] for me?   So said the Holy One:  For nothing else did I create the beasts and animals except for the sake of humanity. Now that humanity is sinning, what [use are they] for me?”
214.18: Why did God destroy the animals in the flood, if it was human beings who had sinned?
